Combine your software and computer architecture expertise to drive the performance of cutting edge IOT technologies - industrial, retail, automotive, health, Edge
AI and more
We're looking for someone passionate about performance benchmarking and optimization to evaluate the latest IOT platform technologies and solutions

IOTG PMCE Platform Capabilities and Applications Engineering team is responsible for delivering SW-Defined, Edge Foundations to accelerate IA Affinity in the IOT Edge and to drive scale for IOTG products

We are looking for highly motivated software engineers with platform end to end solution benchmarking, responsible for understanding platform technology use case requirements, integration, and benchmarking of software ingredients/solutions focusing on cloud technologies like virtualization, containers, and orchestration as well as IOT-unique capabilities like time determinism, functional safety, graphics, media, analytics, edge inference, security, and manageability

Experience in Agile/Scrum/SAFe software development methodologies with good knowledge of SDLC V model
Experience in using Git with knowledge of trunk-based development
Excellent interpersonal, analytical, written, and verbal communication skills with a strong attention to detail
Contribute ideas for continually improving the team's productivity, job enjoyment, and code quality
Experience working with geographically distributed teams across various time zones

Kerry is a company rich in heritage
It was during our modest beginnings as a dairy cooperative in Ireland that we developed our unwavering commitment to producing real and wholesome ingredients
Today, we have become a world leader in taste and nutrition for the food and beverage industry
As we’ve evolved over the last 40 years and grown to meet ever-changing consumer demands and expectations, we have remained steadfastly committed to this early ethos

Over the past four decades, our focus on changing lifestyles, the globalization of food tastes and ever-evolving consumer needs has brought us to a market leading global position with operations in more than 150 sites across six continents

Our relentless drive to innovate and develop new products to meet the changing needs of our customers has led us to create a network of Global Technology & Innovation Centres and Regional Development & Applications Centres
These centers house more than 1,000 highly skilled food scientists and nutritionists, and teams of market researchers who provide insights to drive product development
The centers provide unique leading-edge solutions at an unrivalled speed to market, helping to shape the future of food

What's the role
The Data Engineer reports directly to the Head of Enterprise Data Lake
You will be contributing strongly to the development and maintenance of our Enterprise Data Lake, which is an integral part of Hilti digital transformation agenda
The role will be based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia which is one of the Hilti Global IT hubs
What does the role involve
In your role as a Data Engineer, you are responsible for the development, maintenance and improvement of all the data flows in the enterprise data lake built on AWS cloud platform

You interact directly with various stakeholders (business users, data scientists, analytics teams) to understand their data demand and in turn, design and develop scalable ETL packages from the business source systems, including development of ETL routines, to bring these data into the data lake

You are responsible to perform thorough testing and validation to support accuracy of data transformations and data consistency
You resolve production issues related to data interfaces and ETL/ELT processes in a timely manner
You assess the stability, robustness and efficiency of implemented data pipelines and implement continuous improvement initiatives

As a senior team member, you will also be coaching junior members of the team

Job summary:The Red Hat Asia Pacific (APAC) Deal Desk team is looking for a Senior Deal Desk Analyst to join us in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
In this role, you will be a part of the Centre of Excellence (COE) team within the APAC Deal Desk
You will be responsible for contract management and request for information (RFI), quote and discounting approval, and dashboard reporting and deal tooling enablement

You’ll develop effective communications and enablement to increase awareness of the deal desk programs, processes, and tools available across Red Hat

Dümmen Orange is the world’s largest breeder and propagator of cut flowers, bulbs, tropical plants, pot plants, bedding plants and perennials
For our Research department in De Lier we are looking for a Project Lead Quantitative Genetics
Job objectiveOur organization grows and flourishes
This results in a fast-changing and, therefore, challenging environment
As a Project Lead Quantitative Genetics you will strengthen our Trait Genetics group which is part of the research department
With your background in statistics and genetics, you will contribute to the design of algorithms and pipelines aiming to enable predictive breeding
You will apply these and other technologies to create tools and deliver molecular markers for technology-informed and marker-assisted breeding in a diverse range of crops
You will also work on automating analyses to support breeding and collaborate on building web-apps for breeding to support their breeding decisions
In addition you will support breeding with advice to optimize their breeding schemes in line with their breeding goals and technology-readiness

Collaboration is an important feature of the job, and you will work closely with scientists within Trait Genetics as well as other expertise groups such as Trait Discovery, Plant Physiology, Phytopathology and Breeding
You will report to the Technology Lead Trait Genetics in De Lier

Your tasks and responsibilitiesDesign, improve and maintain algorithms and pipelines in data visualization, quantitative genetics, germplasm management, genomic prediction and marker-assisted breeding as well as contribute to the development of decision-support tools for breeding and research
Initiate, manage and execute projects and significant workpackages focused on Quantitative Genetics
Perform scouting activities for novel tools and technologies
Collect, curate and integrate genomic and phenotypic datasets
Develop and implement quantitative genetic models to support breeding programs in a wide range of crops
Support breeding with advice on breeding management and optimal breeding decisions
Lead projects to implement tools and concepts in breeding programs
Translate findings to optimal application of tools and information
You will also bring quantitative genetics and statistical expertise to the team

You are expected to collaborate closely with other research teams (mainly Computational Biology, Plant Physiology, Trait Discovery, and Phytopathology) and manage relationships with stakeholders such as Technology Application and Breeding
Your profilePhD (or MSc degree with at least 5 years of work experience) in a relevant field in biology (for example animal or plant breeding, plant science, genetics, bioinformatics or similar)

Proven track record in experimental design and in the analysis of (field) trial data, quantitative genetics (linkage mapping, GWAS, heritability and breeding value estimation, genomic prediction, random regression) and exploration of genomic datasets
Excellent programming and visualisation skills in R are a must and ideally you also master one or more other relevant programming languages (such as Python, Fortran, C++)
Proven skills in statistics (multivariate analyses, GLMMs) and some experience with machine learning is preferred
Affinity with plant biology and plant breeding is preferred but not essential
Ability to work independently as well as in fast-paced multidisciplinary teams
Inquisitive, innovative and critical mind-set and a creative and pro-active attitude
Excellent written and oral communication skills which are tailored to the target audience
Excellent command of English and willingness to learn Dutch
We offerDümmen Orange has great global ambitions
Innovation, technology and quality are high priorities

Dümmen Orange offers its employees plenty of room for personal growth and development

SilTerra is a 200mm semiconductor wafer foundry, offering CMOS fabrication processes for integrated circuits (ICs) in Advanced Logic, Mixed Signal & Radio Frequency, and High Voltage applications

Today, as industry convergence continues to shape the future of nanoelectronics in healthcare, life sciences, mobility, and connectivity, SilTerra is collaborating with partners and customers to develop what will be tomorrow’s connected technologies

By building on its current process technologies, SilTerra has progressed into more advanced technology areas such as Silicon Photonics, Bio-photonics, MEMS on CMOS, Gallium Nitride(GaN), BCD and Discrete Power – also known as “More-than-Moore” technologies

SilTerra has been working with customers to develop and launch leading-edge products such as bio-sensors, DNA sequencing chips, next-generation fingerprint sensors, micro-mirror displays, and ultra-low-power chips for applications in IoT, consumer electronics, data communications, industrial automation, healthcare, and automotive segments

SilTerra’s advances in the field of power management and high-efficiency power devices have enabled our customers to address green technology requirements in the mobility and industrial automation markets

Globally ranked 16th by IC Insights in the category of pure-play foundries, SilTerra’s leadership in the industry is the result of years of developing local skills as well as nurturing strategic partnerships

Position: Science Communications Specialist Location: Penang (Malaysia-HQ) or remote home-based in similar time zone Application Deadline: 30 April 2021 Post level: Open to qualified national and international applicants Type of contract: 1 year fixed term with possibility of renewal Language(s) required: English (high proficiency in verbal and written communication) ABOUT WORLDFISH WorldFish is a nonprofit research and innovation institution that creates, advances and translates scientific research on aquatic food systems into scalable solutions with transformational impact on human well-being and the environment
We envision an inclusive world of healthy, well-nourished people and a sustainable blue planet, now and in the future

We are part of One CGIAR, the world’s largest agricultural innovation network, whose mission is to “end hunger by 2030 through science to transform food, land and water systems under threat of climate change

” Our research and innovation work spans climate change, food security and nutrition, sustainable fisheries and aquaculture, the blue economy and ocean governance, OneHealth, genetics and AgriTech, and it integrates evidence and perspectives on gender, youth and social inclusion
Our purpose is to accelerate the sustainable transformation of global food systems toward nutritious diets that sustain the health of people and the planet
Our research data, evidence and insights shape better practices, policies and investment decisions for sustainable development in low- and middle-income countries

As a networked organization embedded in a larger innovation ecosystem of partners, including One CGIAR, our model of operation and beyond is guided by our values that stand for Learning, Excellence, Accountability and Diversity (LEAD)

We have a global presence across 20 countries in Asia, Africa and the Pacific with 460 staff of 30 nationalities deployed where the greatest sustainable development challenges can be addressed through holistic aquatic food systems solutions
ABOUT THE ROLE We are looking for an enthusiastic and results-driven Science Communication Specialist to join our busy and dynamic Communications and Marketing team at the WorldFish headquarters

If you are passionate about working with world-class scientists and engaging with different policymakers, donors and development practitioners to inform and influence the global sustainable development agenda - through scientific evidence and innovative solutions - on issues as diverse as climate change, sustainable ocean governance and inclusive blue growth, food and nutrition security, poverty and livelihoods, gender equality and environmental sustainability, then this is the job for you

Your job is to translate scientific and technical research outputs into influential and accessible communications pieces that successfully engage various audiences of WorldFish, and advance critical evidence-based narratives related to the 2030 WorldFish Research and Innovation Strategy (link here) and our mission ‘to end hunger and advance the SGDs by 2030 through science and innovation to transform food, land and water systems with aquatic foods for healthier people and planet

” Day-to-day, you will be responsible for developing and delivering quality content featured on our main communications channels and platforms (print and digital) and work across teams to ensure messaging is consistent across our channels and brand

Longer-term projects will involve implementing best practices across WorldFish, experimenting with new content types on existing and new communication channels, as well as supporting the larger Communications and Marketing team to create compelling content and strategic communications campaigns for papers, special events, thought leadership, and WorldFish-wide initiatives
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR

You must have a strong foundation in all aspects of evidence-based communications for a science and/or development organization, reflected in your progressive experience with strategic planning, development and implementation of complex communication projects and activities, including high-level conferenced and global events
Moreover, you are a digital native with experience working both strategically and tactically with different digital tools – ideally applying omni-channel approaches
You love to think and plan strategically, and more so you to get going with effective execution
You understand what it takes to create messaging and design processes that engage target audiences
You can grasp complex concepts and structures quickly and can think on your feet
Excellent customer service and relations come naturally to you, and your top-notch interpersonal skills enable you to work well with different people, as well as inspire and motivate them
Most importantly, you are structured and well-organized, and able to handle multiple issues and shifting priorities with ease

This is a challenging and exciting role for a stellar communicator with strong writing skills, excellent networking abilities and an incurable intellectual curiosity to always learn and push yourself outside of the comfort zone
You must be passionate about science and communications and have a knack for seizing opportunities
You have a proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects and people across different regions and time-zones, as well different functions and disciplines
Your results-driven work ethic and your approach to constant learning and innovation sets the bar for others to deliver high-quality results time and again

You have a flair for bringing out the best in multidisciplinary teams operating in complex research programs and the multicultural setting of an international organization, and more importantly you know how to build trust, enable effective teamwork and exceed the expectations of key customers, audiences and partners of WorldFish

KEY REQUIREMENTS This job might be for you if you have the following skills and qualifications: At least 5 years of professional experience in a communications role with a scientific research institution (public or private), international PR/media/Development Communications firm, development agency and/or science philanthropic foundation
Educated to Master’s degree level in Science Communications, Journalism, Marketing and/or scientific discipline that is relevant to WorldFish’s work
Genuine interest in and strong commitment to WorldFish’s vision, mission, value and objectives and the ability to professionally advocate our positions from a solid scientific base

Strong writing and editorial skills (in English) with evidence of proven ability to translate complex scientific work into accessible, engaging and impactful communications content for print and digital publication and distribution
Evidence of strong ability to digest, critically analyze and present complex scientific information clearly and concisely in a wide variety of formats for non-scientific audiences

Experience with and a strong understanding of how print and digital media work, including omni-channel marketing approaches to place and promote science in newspapers, TV, radio, podcasts, targeted e-marketing, social and digital media promotion (YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Flickr, Instagram), etc
Proven ability to connect individual communications activities, initiatives and products to higher-level organizational strategies and goals, and strategize at both macro and micro levels
High level of independence and can-do mentality, strong time and priority management, and an ability to make sound decisions in highly pressured environments
Proven ability to work well under pressure with diverse teams scattered across different time zones and geographies, and to manage complex content production processes and schedules
Experience with helping to coordinate and organize global and national events (virtually and face-to-face)
Team player and natural collaborator with high levels of self-motivation, drive for excellence, attention to details, and used to working flexibly at a fast pace

Proven ability to manage competing priorities and projects, and work patiently and astutely with different groups of internal and external stakeholders in a multicultural, multilingual and virtual environment
RECRUITMENT PROCESS The position will be based in either Penang, Malaysia or remote home-based in similar time zone
Flexible working arrangements can be considered
Interviews are expected to be held by end of April 2021
Shortlisted candidate will be notified and expected to undergo a written assessment and attend a virtual interview

The successful candidate should be available to commence as soon as possible for an initial of one (1) year fixed term contract, with the possibility of contract renewal depending on performance and funding available
WorldFish is an international, non-for-profit research organization that works to reduce hunger, malnutrition and poverty by improving fisheries and aquaculture

With a 45-years track record of leading-edge science, WorldFish generates research evidence and innovations to inform sustainable practices and inclusive policies that enable better livelihoods and healthier diets for millions of poor people, particularly women, who depend on fish for food, nutrition and income
WorldFish is a member of CGIAR , the world’s largest global partnership on agriculture research and innovation for a food secure future
Headquartered in Penang, Malaysia and with regional offices across Africa, Asia and the Pacific, WorldFish leads the cross-disciplinary CGIAR Research Program (CRP) on Fish Agri-Food Systems (FISH)
Master's or Equivalent

About usResearch, Design and Development (RDD) is Dyson's engine room
It’s where our engineers challenge convention, build, test, fail, refine, and then fail again - all to invent technology that solves problems that others ignore
Join us as an intern and from day one you’ll be assigned to a live project with the chance to have a meaningful impact on the evolution of Dyson technology
About the roleWhether you join us for an Industrial training or a 3 month summer internship, you’ll be assigned to a project team from day one
You’ll be expected to hit the ground running on one of Dyson’s many live projects in the Professional & Lightings category
Working as part of a larger project team, you’ll have your own set of project deliverables and the chance to take ownership of how these are achieved

Some of your tasks could include:Developing mechanical parts, assemblies and systems from concept to productionDeveloping and validating mechanical designs that meet specification requirementsConceptualizing, developing and detailing ideas for future mechanical partsDesigning experiments and necessary rigs/fixtures for component and system characterization and validation
Working with engineers and scientists/technical experts across a broad range of disciplines, you’ll be comfortable learning from others, but also sharing your own knowledge, ideas and opinions
We’ll support you with a development framework designed to help you make the most of your internship

About youOur internships are competitive and delivering the next generation of Dyson technology is tough, so you’ll need to:On track for 2nd upper class honours or above and be studying towards a Mechanical, Aerospace, Design Engineering, Mechatronics or related disciplineAble to commit for at least 12 weeks and graduating in August 2022Able to evidence how you have applied your technical knowledge to solve problems, either through your internship, university projects or as part of your extra-curricular activitiesHappy to build your own networks to learn from the technical expertise around youCreative in your approach to problem solving to ensure our machines are betterPassionate about Dyson and our technology to help us meet our ambitious future plansAbove all, you’ll want to play a key part in bringing the next generation of Dyson technology to the world

For your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application:Detailed resume with expected year of graduationUpdated academic transcript / degree auditPlease note that you should only apply to one internship position as multiple applications will delay the selection process
We will consider you for other internship roles should you have the relevant skillset or experience
Shortlisted candidates will undergo our early careers recruitment and selection process which could include digital assessments and on-site interviews
BenefitsProfessional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops
And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fueling and realizing ambition
Interview guidanceWe are following the government guidelines regarding COVID19
At this time all interviews will be conducted via video or telephone
We’re taking these precautionary measures to protect both our employee and candidate wellbeing
Our Talent Acquisition team will work with you and provide further information as appropriate
Closing date: 05 March 2021
We are a leading chemical company, with the best teams developing intelligent solutions for our customers and for a sustainable future
Our success as a company relies on the engagement of our employees
We encourage our employees to develop their strengths, and we recognize their achievements
For you, this means a wide variety of job roles, and exciting opportunities for learning and career development
DescriptionThe BASF Shared Services Center Kuala Lumpur was established in 2005

Located in Kuala Lumpur, it has approximately 700 employees and provides functional services in the areas of Finance, Controlling, Information Services, Human Resources, Environment, Health & Safety, Procurement, and Import-Export Order Management to BASF companies and affiliates in 17 markets across Asia Pacific
BASF also has three other Shared Service Centers that cover Europe and the Americas, located in Berlin and Ludwigshafen, Germany, and Montevideo, Uruguay

As a Non-Volatile Engineering Group (NVEG) Product Reliability Test Engineer at Micron Technology, Inc
, you are responsible for developing and maintaining reliability testing for Micron’s leading edge next generation non-volatile memory devices
You will develop test code and perform failure analysis and data analysis to ensure Micron’s devices meet all internal and external qualification requirements
The tests you develop will provide critical reliability data and characterization to engineering teams throughout the company

Responsibilities:Responsible for reliability test development, test code, and support scriptsDefine and improve testing methods to address new product qualification issues on devices manufactured at Micron’s R&D facilityPerform device characterization and electrical failure analysis (EFA) - Design, develop, test/debug, document, and deploy software applicationsConduct system software requirements and readiness reviewsDefine interface hardware specifications and perform validation and debug of new interface boardsRequirements:A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, with Course work in VLSI, semiconductor process, and C/C++Excellent knowledge and experience developing with object-oriented programming (Python, C++, C#)Thorough understanding of PythonGood knowledge and experience with database applications (SQL, MySQL, Hadoop)Understanding of high performance computing conceptsGood understanding and experience with Unix/Linux operating systemsKnowledge of non-volatile memory architecture and operation (NAND, NOR, etc)Knowledge of statistics and data analysis toolsStrong problem solving and analytical skillsEffective communication and presentation skillsExcellent project management skillsSelf-motivated and enthusiasticDemonstrated ability to partner successfully with other groups to build strong peer relationships and meet customers’ needsAbout UsAs the leader in innovative memory solutions, Micron is helping the world make sense of data by delivering technology that is transforming how the world uses information
Through our global brands — Micron, Crucial and Ballistix — we offer the industry’s broadest portfolio
We are the only company manufacturing today’s major memory and storage technologies: DRAM, NAND, NOR and 3D XPoint™ memory
Our solutions are purpose built to leverage the value of data to unlock financial insights, accelerate scientific breakthroughs and enhance communication around the world

The role in a nutshellThe role is a great opportunity for someone who is keen to be part of a global cryptocurrency business
In Malaysia, with Luno owning more than 90% of the market share, this is a perfect opportunity to join the largest regulated digital asset exchange in Malaysia
Business Analysts conduct market analyses, analyse business metrics, product lines and growth initiatives to support the countries team to achieve overall profitability of the business
You will be based in the Kuala Lumpur office, and work directly with the General Manager (SEA) and Country Managers in the region to excel in your mission

Your mission will involveGenerate and update business metrics, conduct detailed analysis and provide feedback on the business's growth metrics — including key items like conversion funnel (users signup to transaction), marketing spending (such as cost per acquisition), trading volume, and revenue — on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis

Based on the analysis, you will identify potential issues, conduct investigation, and validate the problems that you've identified by collaborating with General Managers, business specialists, Country Managers / Leads
You will also be required to perform product testing on the ground where necessary
You will coordinate with the General Manager, Country Managers, and other business functions to ensure that the business solutions/recommendations are implemented within agreed timelines
You will support growth initiatives in the region, including in the aspects of research, coordination, completion and analysis of a project
For example, you will provide support in data analysis for ongoing marketing projects (calculating Customer's Return of Investment, Lifetime Value, Luno Rewards point calculation etc) every month

Support the local team in gathering customer feedback from customers in the region in any growth initiatives within the region as well as to support/validate problems that's identified via data analytics
Conduct any ad hoc research & sourcing work to support Luno's business in the region

Environmental engineers are experts tasked with successfully minimizing and managing various sources of waste pollution to guard air, water, soil, and living things from harm
They accomplish their goals by working in areas such as waste or wastewater treatment, site remediation, or pollution control
They often write environmental investigation reports detailing findings, and they serve as liaisons between the companies they work for and federal, state, and local environmental agencies
Most environmental engineers work 40-hour weeks
When managing certain projects, the possibility of longer hours is not uncommon
Often environmental scientists, not engineers, gather data from a natural environment, analyze it, and make a recommendation regarding how to implement a beneficial change
Environmental engineers rely on this type of data, utilizing it, along with their engineering and environmental science knowledge, to create a solution for a change that is needed

POSITION SUMMARYAs a Wildlife Analyst for Panthera’s Project Kenyir, the employee shall work in a team to carry out the fieldwork required to fulfill the project’s monitoring, research and patrol activities with the aim to study and conserve the wild cat population in the Kenyir-Taman Negara Core Area
The employee will do so by adhering to the code of conduct and standard operating procedures of Wild Cat Conservation Malaysia (PWCCM)
As an employee of PWCCM, the Wildlife Analyst will uphold the organisation’s values and operating principles and maintain a professional work etiquette at all times

The employee may be required to assist with other projects of Panthera in other field sites from time to time for transfer of knowledge, skills and experience, at the discretion of the Malaysia Country Manager as and when needed

A Wildlife Analyst will be required to oversee and execute the biological monitoring activities to understand the status of Kenyir’s wild cat population and their prey in order to inform conservation strategies

The successful candidate should be equipped with the right skills, knowledge and experience to make sound decisions in the field to guide their field team safely as well as lead briefings and debriefs for camera trapping fieldwork
This role will report to the Project Manager of Project Kenyir/Country Manager of Panthera Malaysia
RESPONSIBILITIESPlan and execute all biological monitoring activities under the project
Oversee and manage field assistants and work with patrol leaders to execute the wildlife monitoring surveys diligently, safely, and in a timely manner
Participate in the implementation of monitoring and patrol activities involving camera traps
Upkeep the inventory of all equipment used for biological monitoring activities, including camera traps, cable locks, batteries, etc
Analyse all related wildlife data and work alongside other analysts on the team to ensure information is amalgated to inform the overall strategy for wild cat protection
Process and catalogue all wildlife data from the biological monitoring surveys
Produce reports on wildlife and all monitoring activities in a timely manner
Assist in the collection of patrol data to be stored into the Spatial Monitoring and Reporting Tool (SMART) database
Maintain a camera trap database on SMART Field SensorsAssist in the preparation of maps and equipment for patrols, briefing and debriefing sessions
Participate and lead in briefing, strategy planning, and debriefing sessions as and when required
Assist in the preparation of post operation reports
Essential DutiesThe essential job functions of a Wildlife Analyst of Project Kenyir are as follows:Establish and maintain good relations with partners and stakeholders of the project
Ensure professional conduct within the team as well as with parners and stakeholders of the project, including government representatives
Ensure that all assigned activities are consistent with the schedule and all outputs are delivered on time and at the desired quality
Keep abreast with current research and developments in biodiversity monitoring and wildlife crime science
This may require attending various meetings, workshops, conferences and training programmes

Be familiar and comply with the policies and guidelines set out in the Panthera Employee’s Handbook ensuring that the code of conduct & ethics and ‘Patrol Standard Operating Procedures’ are followed at all times
Be familiar and comply with Panthera’s programmatic vision, objectives and plans, and intellectual property rights
Ensure compliance with all applicable national laws and regulations of Malaysia
QUALIFICATIONSMinimum qualification of Bachelor’s Degree in Biology, Conservation Science or equivalent

1-2 years of working experience is preferablePersonal qualities of integrity, credibility and unwavering commitment to Panthera’s missionMeticulous with a keen eye for detailsStrong physique, with the ability to trek in the forest, carrying weight of around 15kg on multi-day patrolsAbility to work under pressure and be based in remote areas to carry out fieldworkAbility to work in a team and adhere to protocols and safety guidelinesAbility to communicate well and professionallySome knowledge of the conservation and policy environment in MalaysiaBahasa Malaysia language proficiency requiredDriving license (D) would be preferableEOE/M/F/D/V/SOpqxZU8fQet

As Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) Analyst, you are part of our Cybersecurity Solutions team in our office in Kuala Lumpur, where you will be involved in the continuous maturation of our Security Operations Centre (SOC) that will monitor our IT/IoT/OT assets

You will work in close collaboration and partnership with our newly established Chief Cyber Security Officer organisation in Switzerland, our Global IT Engineering teams, our Digital Software & Services teams, and our Legal and Data Protection organization and external service providers
Who is Hilti
We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software, and services for the global construction sector
Hilti is a multicultural workplace with 127 different nationalities in 60 countries committed to global teamwork
Global IT within Hilti is a truly global team with main hubs in Buchs (Switzerland), Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia) and Plano/Tulsa (USA)
All locations have highly competent teams who work very closely together
Hilti`s Global IT team is known for their focus on sustainable value creation by translating latest IT innovations into value creating solutions & services
What does the role involve
As part of an international team of experts, you are responsible for and will perform end to end cyber threat Intelligence analysis for the Hilti Group while embedded within our SOC organization
You will be required to perform rapid identification of advanced cyber threats
You will manage and orient internal and external sources of intelligence, review threat reports/feeds, and digest threat information into actionable threat intelligence
You will respond in a coordinated fashion by leveraging actionable intelligence to inform stakeholders and mitigate the risk

You will manage a threat intelligence platform, optimize its integration with other cyber security systems, optimize cyber threat intelligence models, and develop/maintain strategic cyber intelligence-related partnerships
You will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of cyber threat intelligence analysis and reporting in Global IT operations
You will support the identification and documentation of Indicators of Compromise (IoCs)

You will perform threat research to identify tactics, techniques and procedures (TTP) of threat actors and work with Cyber Security Engineers and Security Incident Responders to improve prevention and detection methods
You will also contribute to the overall performance and success of the SOC function
You will build intelligence sharing relationships with all the relevant security agencies to better serve the security interests of the Hilti Group
You will closely collaborate with Cyber Security Engineers and other specialists in the team and with colleagues in IT Operations
We want to build the most highly automated, and extremely agile SOC in the construction and manufacturing industry
What do we offer
Show us what you’re made of and we’ll offer you opportunities to move around the business – to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets
It’s a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you’re after
We have a very thorough people review process, unlike any we know of in any other business
We can pair talent with opportunities - developing our people in their current roles or challenging them to work in new ways or in new places
It’s how we find the right fit, further our teams personally and professionally, get the best value for each employee, and increase the job satisfaction
Additionally, we offer you a wide range of benefits
While there is no 24/7 shift duty, you are required to be on-call
We also offer progression into more senior roles over time
We are willing to invest in your further professional training
Why should you apply
We are seeking creative, innovative, and open-minded people with a demonstrated ability to work both independently and in a global team setting
You will possess strong analytical skills, knowledge, and experience in cyber threat intelligence analysis, coupled with excellent oral and written communication skills
We seek subject matter experts with a proven ability to deliver threat intelligence analysis in a user-centric environment
What you need is:Must Have

Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or a related technical discipline related to information security, cyber, or computer network defense10 + years’ experience working in Cyber Security including at least 5 years in Cyber Threat IntelligenceProven subject matter expertise in relevant areas, such as threat hunting, threat detection research, malware analysis, cyber threat intelligence, network securityStrong analytical and problem-solving skills paired with excellent interpersonal and communication skillsKnowledge of MITRE ATT@CK framework and red teaming and offensive security best practicesAbility to identify IOCs, evaluate existing defenses against identified attacks to determine weaknesses, correlate intelligence to identify campaigns, profile actors, and track such activities

Must have hand-on experience in SIEM/XDR/SOAR/TIP/EDR/NTA platformsFluent in English (verbally and written)Two or more of the following: - CISSP, GCTI, GCIH, GSE(C), GREM, GCFA, GCIA, GSNA, GPPA, OSCPMust be very comfortable in scripting languages (Python, JavaScript, PHP)Good to have

Working experience in the manufacturing industryExperience with IoT systems and or OT systemsExperience in security incident response/digital forensicExperience in cybersecurity or systems engineeringCome Join Us

DescriptionPrimary Objective:Organizations using DevOps practices operate at insane high velocity
They deploy code up to 30 times more frequently than their competitors, and 50 percent fewer of their deployments fail

Center of Excellence (COE) for DevXOps under Digital Technology & Engineering, Group Digital Transformation consists of a group of multi-skilled software and systems engineers who develop e2e pipeline automation (CI/CD), containerization, cloudification, dev test automation (DevTestOps), dev security automation (DevSecOps) and evolve DevOps to achieve high velocity without compromising service reliability as well as to reduce Development and Operations friction
This is a role that fulfils promising emerging skillset demand in a digitalizing industry and at the same time provides the opportunity to acquire and command a DevOps niche in banking

As a DevSecOps EngineerContinuously tackle delivery and operations hurdles between developers (Build) and IT Ops (Run) by making software development lifecycle extremely efficient to allow releases at high velocity, quality and frequency, with specific specialization in software security and compliance

And at the same time work on a never-ending mission to avoid deployment and operational issues from coming back to the Build domain by scaling up shift left capabilities and empowering developers and IT operations alike to self-serve

The goal is to minimize the need for L3 intervention at all and reduce surprises during Penetration Testing prior to a product/feature release by strengthening early security and compliance requirements and validations

As Level 3 Support for DigitalAct as Level 3 Technical Subject Matter Expert for Group Digital Transformation applications when IT Level 2 support hits the wall on matters related to software security

Key Responsibilities:DevSecOps AutomationOwn responsibility for secure coding methodologies and mechanisms for products under Group Digital purview Advocate choices through a security lens for the entire development lifecycle, including design, coding & development, QA & security testing, and release

Lead design and implementation of secure SDLC Design and develop generic security patterns and guidelines to enable applications stay compliant Develop and enhance Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery/Deployment and automated infrastructure provisioning DevOps fixtures including build processes Provide leadership in the DevSecOps areas of Vulnerability Scanning, Certificate Management, Password Policy Management, Data Analysis of security monitoring outputs, coordination of Remediation Patching, and other daily Security and Compliance efforts Participate in developing an automated security framework for robust deployment tools and processes, leveraging various scripting languages, and open source solutions Provide guidance on DevSecOps industry best practices to the platform teams, architecture teams, the product management team, and the application development team(s)

To support project delivery which is based on legacy sequential sdlc (requirement, design, development, sit, uat, non-functional tests, deployment, production) by helping the developers and testers to solve testing issues in non-prod specifically in the area of security and compliance
While supporting the above, build custom solutions to remove toils that were needed to solve issues or escalations and avoid future reoccurrence

This can be achieved through means such as enabling Compliance-as-Code in the pipeline or by simply establishing adequate knowledge management or processes to promote self-regulated security and compliance
Co-own the pipeline for product delivery, security and compliance testing, and releases in order to improve reliability and to provide faster deployment cycles
Work as an integrated part of the software engineering organization, understanding the application architecture
Work with the Platform team to ensure environment setup and automation (on-premise or cloud) fulfils security, risks and compliance expectations
Work with Technology Strategy team to perform Technology Risk Assessment on new products
Bring innovation into process by implementing automated mechanism to eliminate manual tasks related to security, risks and compliance

Design static analysis and test to ensure the integrity of deployment artifactsShift environment management from traditional environment to be scalable, auditable and traceableDevelop a pipeline standard where they are able to be deployed to new project

Change the way of release by delivering automation in software release process in RHBContribute to IT modernization to get RHB Group to adapt deployment automationConnect multiple tools to foster wider range of automationDeliver collaboration project with security/test/infra in Group Technology (IT)Buddy new joiners/assignees in the COE DevXOps to scale DevSecOps Engineers in RHB
Contribute new knowledge to Chapter and the industry in form of talks or articles

L3 SupportEnsure effective L3 expertise and support on delivery and production operations related issues which may occur at any hour, specifically with regards to security and compliance related to the applications under Group Digital purview
However, DevXOps motivation is to prevent such occurrence from happening and when it does happen, L2 support is to be equipped to handle them most of the time
Proactively understand at high level code-base and features developed by the Feature Development squads to be able to intervene and segregate design relation issues in production

Proactively learn about platform actual performance by participating, identifying and resolving production and application development problems with Production Platform (JBOSS, Kony or future DCP technology stacks) Admin and L2 Operations
Act as a formidable checker for technology vendors (i

RedHat, Kony, IBM, Database vendors) during L3 troubleshooting to ensure balanced and quick turnaround Answer user questions and prepare users by conducting training/knowledge sharing when requiredEnsure effective collaboration with architects, developers and IT Operations to tackle security technical debt

Support L2 on the production bugs, Testing team during the SIT, UAT related to software securityLearn continuously to evolve COE DevXOps domain expertiseRepresent the team in relevant external events and forums
Contribute new knowledge to Chapter and the industry in form of talks or articles
Ensure Confluence/Knowledge Management continuously updated with DevSecOps knowledgeRequirementsRequirements:Bachelor Degree - • Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Technology/IT/Engineering
Active contribution to the Software Engineering community through talks, meet ups or published articles
5 years and above in ICT, with experience in Software Engineering

Identify training needs and mentor lower level staff to build on the capabilities of the team

Company descriptionThe IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people
We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them

We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment

ID: 254846Job DescriptionAs a DRAM and Emerging Memory Quality and Reliability Assurance (DEMQRA)Returned Material Authorization (RMA) Engineer at Micron Technology, Inc
, you will be responsible for overseeing and tracking the formal Failure Analysis (FA) of customer-returned product
You will summarize analysis at the electrical and physical level, identifying root cause, and establishing an associated containment plan

Job Description :Job DescriptionCome join Intel's Product Enablement Solutions Group organization as a CAD Engineer
In this role you will be shaping the future of computing
We bring innovative technologies to the most complex microprocessor and SoC products on the planet
You will be part of developing new and creative methods to increase efficiency and reduce time to market for these designs, helping to increase Intel's lead in computing
You will combine knowledge of logic and circuit design with software development techniques to deliver cutting edge solutions, shaping the way these products come to life
You will work with the best engineering talent in the world to collaborate on these new methods
You will play a pivotal role in our mission to revolutionize computing
Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to:Deploying software tools to the design team, creating and delivering effective documentation and training, and providing support
Support and maintenance of design environment infrastructure components
Automating design tasks in order to complete the product design in the most efficient fashion possible
Developing solutions to problems utilizing formal education and judgment
Developing state of the art tools and flows in the power estimation domain
QualificationsYou must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position
Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates
Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences

Minimum Qualifications:BS or MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer ScienceMinimum 3 years' experience with software programming and debuggingMinimum 3 years' experience with TCL, Perl, or CMinimum 3 years' experience in at least one of the following skill sets: computer architecture, digital logic, Very Large Scale Integration (VLSI) Complementary MOS (CMOS) circuits, VLSI layoutMinimum 3 years' experience in at least one of the following skill sets: Algorithms and Data Structures, VLSI CAD, Database SystemsPreferred qualifications:3+ years experience in the above skill setsThe ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:Problem-solving skillsAbility to multitaskStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to work in a dynamic and team oriented environmentInside this Business GroupThe Product Enablement Solutions Group (PESG) is a worldwide organization that delivers an end-to-end design system for development of IPs, Cores and SOCs

This business group partners with the Semiconductor, IP and EDA eco-systems and leverages an incomparable mix of experts with different backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, and experiences to deliver a world-class design system that powers Intel's leadership products

About usResearch, Design and Development (RDD) is Dyson's engine room
It’s where our engineers challenge convention, build, test, fail, refine, and then fail again - all to invent technology that solves problems that others ignore
Join us as an intern and from day one you’ll be assigned to a live project with the chance to have a meaningful impact on the evolution of Dyson technology
In MDC’s Technology Development Environment Care functional teams, you will experience the fast paced project handling process
The Functional Teams consist of multiple disciplines – Structural Analysis, Motor & Filtration system, Acoustic and Vibration and Fluid Dynamics
Within the functional teams, we ensure project deliverables in each discipline are closed in timely manner and reported to stakeholders
About the roleWhether you join us for an Industrial Attachment placement or a 3 month summer internship, you’ll be assigned to a project team from day one
You’ll be expected to hit the ground running on one of Dyson’s many live projects
Working as part of a larger project team, you’ll have your own set of project deliverables and the chance to take ownership of how these are achieved

Some of your tasks could include:Conceptualising, developing and proposing design changes to optimize product performanceCreating analytic tools and/or models that could help to make analysis lean or solve specific problemsExposure to different test methods to verify product’s performance and systems engineering approach used in technology development teamGather available data and analyse to find out root cause of problems and solve the problemIntegrate into the day-to-day operation of the teamAbout youWorking at the forefront of technology is tough so standards and expectations are high
You’ll be contributing to live projects from the start so you’ll need to be curious, hungry to learn and ready to get stuck in
But it’s not just about technical expertise

Our internships are competitive and delivering the next generation of Dyson technology is tough, so you’ll need to:On track for 2nd upper class honours or above and be studying towards a Mechanical, Aerospace, Mechatronics or related disciplineAble to commit for at least 12 weeks and graduating in August 2022Be passionate about mechanical analysis and understand fundamental principles such as Computational Fluid Dynamics or Finite Element AnalysisAble to evidence how you have applied your technical knowledge to solve problems, either through your university projects or as part of your extra-curricular activitiesHappy to build your own networks to learn from the technical expertise around youCreative in your approach to problem solving to ensure our machines are betterPassionate about Dyson and our technology to help us meet our ambitious future plansAbove all, you’ll want to play a key part in bringing the next generation of Dyson technology to the world

For your application to be considered, you are required to upload the following documents together with your online application:Detailed resume with expected year of graduationUpdated academic transcript / degree auditPlease note that you should only apply to one internship position as multiple applications will delay the selection process
We will consider you for other internship roles should you have the relevant skillset or experience
Shortlisted candidates will undergo our early careers recruitment and selection process which could include digital assessments and interviews
BenefitsProfessional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops
And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition
Interview guidanceWe are following the government guidelines regarding COVID19
At this time all interviews will be conducted via video or telephone
We’re taking these precautionary measures to protect both our employee and candidate wellbeing
Our Talent Acquisition team will work with you and provide further information as appropriate
Closing date: 05 March 2021

You get unlimited access to people (founders included), opportunities to learn, coffee, and WiFi – and we consider these the basic necessities
There’s also an office indoor mini-golf course, ping pong, cool pantry, FaveUp learning sessions featuring industry veterans, movie nights, and lots more
If being a part of a digital revolution in the fastest-growing region in the world excites you, get in touch today

Product Design at FaveWe don’t follow the traditional corporate model, but empower our people to own their work end-to-end, that’s what you’ll be in charge of in your Product team: lead the product from a design perspective, having a holistic approach on the experience, from discovery to delivery - always keeping in mind our customers and their interests
As a Product Designer, you will:-be partnering with the Product Manager, Engineers, Data Scientists, and other colleagues, working in a cross-functional and distributed team
Together, you will be actively involved in defining the customers’ and the business’ problems
work with Product Manager to identify the key metrics for the projects you are involved in and take ownership for achieving their success
research and bring forward new findings and learnings for reaching complex company goals - such as launching in new territories and offering new products
from wire-framing to designing end-to-end flows and prototypes, you will be in charge of designing products that solve problems in a simple and elegant way while taking care of every small detail
we love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution that truly solves customer needs, thus you will be running user testing workshops and guerrilla testing
once that’s done, iterate, implement with the technical team and present the final solution during the design reviews
We are not stopping here, we believe in continuous improvement, so you’ll review the performance of the release, identify learnings and find ways to enhance it

Requirements:-2 to 3 years of experience in designing web and App interfaceFigma or SketchAble to build interactive prototype on Figma or InVisionA portfolio featuring examples of product design workThe ability to take ownership of design process and work as self-directed member of the development teamThink user experience firstClean visual design senseSkills in typography and gridsLove to solve problems and be challengedTo be a constant learner
You will be always growing - both personally and with the team

Job DescriptionThe Maintenance Technician is responsible to maintain adequately all plant types of equipment, to perform the preventive maintenance program and address all plant equipment problems effectively and efficiently with necessary corrective actions to minimize the loss in production time and capacity
You will also be responsible to assist and support the engineer on a project basis for the plant
To assist the maintenance engineer to ensure the safety of machinery structure in the plant
To weld, fabricate and repair any necessary faulty parts of the machine
To complete and record the monthly maintenance checklist
To take care of plant facilities such as leakage of pneumatic air and water, building doors, changing of the steam gasket, and piping jobs
To take care of the tools at the workshop
To repair the pumps such as changing the mechanical seal, lubrication and greasing
Perform necessary maintenance for building and facilities
Routine inspection on all machinery as per schedule and non-scheduled maintenance
Sustain machine in good condition and the uptime of the equipment meeting the operational goals of uptime, cost and yield
Participate in start-up and shut down activities
To establish and implement preventive maintenance and calibration of equipment
To train the operator on equipment maintenance
Carry out preventative and corrective maintenance work required in the plant
Manage mechanical maintenance work
To complete any mechanical tasks assigned by Superior / Head of Department
To obey company rules and regulation
QualificationsMinimum SKM3 / Diploma in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent
At least 3 years of working experience in the FMCG industry, preferably in the food & beverage
Possess hands-on electrical repairing or mechanical maintenance know-how
Self-motivated, able to work with minimum supervision

Intern Program – Data Research Intern/ApprenticeAbout IHS MarkitAt the heart of IHS Markit, we are an information company

With expertise across the world’s largest industries, we leverage technology and data science to provide the insights, software, and data to help our customers make better informed decisions, driving growth, performance, and efficiency

The unique insights we provide help the industries and markets that drive our economies operate more efficiently, outpace competition and secure long-term success
Our global insights impact nearly every major sector - from aerospace to automotive

Maritime & Trade by IHS Markit is the leading source of maritime data and expertise

By connecting Sea-web’s comprehensive ship and ownership data with AISLive’s terrestrial and satellite ship movement intelligence, Maritime Portal delivers a powerful market-leading solution
Ships, movements, maritime intelligence and insight are integrated into one online solution
This enables deeper analysis of the global shipping fleet and answer’s the industry’s needs by utilizing all of Maritime & Trade’s capabilities

Alypz Sdn
(formerly known as Asia Lab) was incorporated in 1985 and was the first company in Malaysia that has dual licenses from the Malaysian Atomic Energy Licensing Board and Ministry of Health
Alypz pioneered the Technologically Enhanced Naturally Occurring Radioactive Material (TENORM) management programme in Malaysia in early 90’s

Today, Alypz is the market leader serving all the top oil and gas companies in NORM/ TENORM monitoring services in ASEAN region, as well as providing comprehensive radiation services across various industries involved with radioactive materials

With strict adherence to our Quality Management System and MS ISO/IEC 17025, the company has demonstrated its excellent ability to be a primary radiation service provider to all its clients for the past 30 years
In 2007, Alypz started offering more monitoring and consultancy services for issues relate to industrial hygiene

With available resources and competencies, Alypz has demonstrated its ability to meet the requirements of the industries to assist them in controlling and managing the environmental and/or occupational exposure to radiation and hazardous chemicals
Emphasizing that environment protection is important for survival, Alypz always committed “Towards a Safer Environment”
(a) Vision - To be one-stop solution provider for occupation health, safety, security and environment assessment, certification, and advisory services

Established to answer the nation's demand for cement, Tasek Corporation Berhad was incorporated in 1962 as Tasek Cement Limited and listed on the stock exchange the following year

It commenced cement production in 1964 with an annual rated production capacity of 250,000 tonnes at its present plant in the Tasek Industrial Estate, Ipoh against the backdrop of scenic limestone hills and excellent infrastructure

Since then, Tasek had embarked on a series of multi-million ringgit expansions in tandem with the country's development, culminating in the latest rehabilitation and expansion programme designed to increase the plant's annual clinker production to 2
3 million tonnes per year Cement is produced at the Company's plant in Ipoh which operates 24 hours a day
Cement is then transported by road or rail direct to the users
Cement is also sent to its packing and distribution terminal at Sungai Buloh for storage, packing and channelling to strategic distribution centres and to users in the Central and Southern regions
Tasek is also an active member of the Cement and Concrete Association of Malaysia or the C&CA, contributing to defining the direction and growth of cement manufacturers in Malaysia

About the Job: We are looking for process engineer for our new semiconductor production line

This is a chance not only to get experiences in engineering, but also to get exposure to the business side and "sell" your engineering work to our customers

Perform engineering build for customer samples and qual samples

o To monitor process performance during engineering build and after release to mass production
o Provide training and mentorship to operators

Preferably 3 years of experience as a process engineer in the semiconductor industry
Most important: You know what a “semiconductor wafer” is, and you are not afraid to handle them in a production line
Any hands-on experience in at least one of the following areas will increase your chances with us
Photolithography ii
Metallization Processes (PVD) iii
Electroplating Some experiences in technologies like Cu-RDL or Cu-Pillar, or WLP in general
Familiar with concepts and documents like FMEA, Control Plan, SPC, Work Instruction, as this role will expose you to the production line
Good presentation, communication and team working skills
As in this role, you have to communicate with production operators, your fellow engineers, our customers, our suppliers, and many others

Environmental engineers are experts tasked with successfully minimizing and managing various sources of waste pollution to guard air, water, soil, and living things from harm
They accomplish their goals by working in areas such as waste or wastewater treatment, site remediation, or pollution control
They often write environmental investigation reports detailing findings, and they serve as liaisons between the companies they work for and federal, state, and local environmental agencies
Most environmental engineers work 40-hour weeks
When managing certain projects, the possibility of longer hours is not uncommon
Often environmental scientists, not engineers, gather data from a natural environment, analyze it, and make a recommendation regarding how to implement a beneficial change
Environmental engineers rely on this type of data, utilizing it, along with their engineering and environmental science knowledge, to create a solution for a change that is needed
* ACHIEVE CUSTOMER SATISFACTION
* PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY PRODUCTS SERVICES
* SAVE THE EARTH, LESS POLLUTION IN FUTURE
Bachelor's or Equivalent

Job Responsibilities of a Bioinformatics Engineer The job responsibilities of a bioinformatics engineer are as follows: • The bioinformatics engineer usually works in close relation with the end users of the scientific department and the project managers so as to make and analyze the needs of the organization • He provides useful assistance for the proper functioning of the analysis and unified stem cell information management systems • He is involved in the enforcement of the information security and user access control activities whenever required • In order to facilitate the analysis and unified stem cell information management systems, the bioinformatics engineer distributes, formulates, and engineers the open source application solutions • He upholds and produces the records of system level for the applications, procedures, and information as per the requirement • He may create manuscript and grant level write ups for the examination methodologies and software solutions • He provides support to the scientists in the improvement of the examination work and innovative information visualization solutions • He performs the tasks that are related to the study and organization of the information gathered • He looks after the improvement of equipments for the purpose of automatizing the quality reporting of the sequence information and DNA sequence assemblies • He sustains and creates infrastructure for the maintenance of the sequencing information and other related data • He modifies and upkeeps the new data in the internal databases • He makes sure that the information entered is accurate, precise, consistent, and correct • He is responsible for making competent writing materials in order to make sure that there is a smooth functioning of the biological research activities • He works in relation with the collaborators for achieving the objective of creating databases for regaining, maintaining, and examining the biological information

Other Responsibilities of a Bioinformatics Engineer The other responsibilities of a bioinformatics engineer are given below: • The bioinformatics engineer takes the responsibility of executing proper interpretations of the biological information • He applies algorithms in an assembling atmosphere for performing high turnout investigation, recovering the data, updating peer-reviewed journals, and executing exchange of vital information • He prepares server side codes for the applications that are related to the web • He helps different users and stakeholders so as to accomplish the needs of analysis • He executes the task of conceptually creating the models of database and producing the features of bioinformatics resources • With a view to ensure development of system activities, the bioinformatics engineer creates concepts and transmits the needs of the user to the engineers • He combines controlled ontologies and information standards in the various components of the system • He is required to organize different resources and set up and enforce a sensible plan for the projects Requirements of a Bioinformatics Engineer The basic requirements of a bioinformatics engineer are listed below: • The applicant should possess a bachelor's degree in computer science, bioinformatics, biology or equivalent field with good knowledge about general life sciences and genomic investigation techniques • He should be proficient with combining and adjusting the solutions that are related to the heterogeneous biological systems • He should possess expertise in handling data repositories and equipment of bioinformatics • He should be familiar with the programming languages such as Python, C++, Perl, and Java • He should have the ability to conform to the shifting priorities and perform multitasking • He should be able to make use of PostgreSQL and MySQL for the purpose of warehousing, molding, and developing the management systems designed for the biological data • He should be well versed with the biological application solutions and conceptions of data examination • He must be capable of troubleshooting the software which is research graded and provided by the third party • He should have the ability to think, analyze, and learn individually

Besides, he should be able to present the models and projects efficiently and develop professional relations with the team members • He must have an expertise in demonstrating superior written and oral communication skills with an eye for detailingChishti Malangee Sdn

develops and commercializes scientific business intelligence software for biotechnology companies globally, for the integration, mining, analysis, modeling and simulation, management and interactive reporting of scientific data
We are a company that combines financial stability and a strong market position in bioinformatics solutions
Apart from the abovementioned, our company aims to provide leading edge bioinformatics products for various applications including microarray, proteomics, Glycomics and other related areas
In addition, we plan to provide the computational tools for Clinical Medicine in the areas of diagnostics and prognostics
Chishti Malangee also provides computational solutions for better decision making and knowledge management in the life science industry
Our flexible and comprehensive solutions provide access to relevant knowledge at the right time and in the right context
Main missions include: • Managing a computing infrastructure dedicated to scientific computing
• Providing advice and support in data analysis (genomic, transcriptomic, metagenomic, annotation, etc
• Designing and developing information systems for processing and analysing data
• Training investigators in the application of bioinformatics tools

Company DescriptionCGG is a global geoscience technology leader

Employing around 4,000 people worldwide, CGG provides a comprehensive range of data, products, services and equipment that supports the discovery and responsible management of the Earth’s natural resources
Our geoscience solutions bring the expertise of our many exceptional people - geophysicists, geologists, data scientists, geospatial experts, reservoir specialists etc
– together with high quality data and new technology to deliver fresh insights and solve the world’s natural resource, environmental and infrastructure challenges for a more sustainable future

Working as part of a team, emphasis will be on taking ownership of assigned tasks, managing day-to-day operations of large and complex projects, providing optimal quality control, identifying problems, and defining ideal solutions
Our Imaging personnel also work closely with our Research and Software Development team to develop new innovative solutions

sharing of resources, knowledge, experience and best practices

About usOur advanced manufacturing sets us apart – we set the lowest tolerances and highest production values to develop heaters that not only perform better, but are built better too

Each generation of Dyson technology must set the benchmark for the next
Our Manufacturing Quality team is involved in the early development of projects and work across and influence our multi-functional teams in RDD & Operations and suppliers
The Quality team is responsible of the overall quality of the materials, product, analysing data and customer feedback

About the roleAs a Graduate Manufacturing Quality Engineer, you will be reporting to Senior Manufacturing Quality Engineer, this role is responsible to ensure the highest standards of quality in our product designs, manufacturing output and owner experience
You’ll be expected to hit the ground running on one of Dyson’s many live projects, applying your university knowledge from the get go

Some of your tasks could include:Review drawings, routings, work instructions and various related production and development plans for quality requirementsWork closely with the Cross Functional Team during Product Development Project Milestones (Engineering Readiness (ER) until product End of Life (EOL))Develop and maintain positive relations and effectual communication lines with all functions, vendors and customersDevelop and execute plans for quality and control to ensure constant manufacturing continuity and product conformance using quality tools plus statistical techniquesSupport quality goals and objectives along with activities to identify, explain and resolve quality issuesAnalysing production limitations and standards and recommending revision of specifications when indicatedReview and revise quality documentation as neededParticipate as Material Review Board member to review Non-Conforming Material and Product as suitable for the operationInvestigate customer complaints and issues arise in the customer / contract manufacturer together with the cross functional team

About youDelivering the next generation of Dyson technology is tough, so you’ll need to be:On track for 2nd upper class honours or above and be studying towards Chemistry, Physics, Chemical Engineering or any related to Engineering with statistical knowledgeBe graduating in Aug 2021Able to understand and manipulate large and complex data setAble to evidence how you have applied your technical knowledge to solve problems, either through your internship, university projects or as part of your co-curricular activitiesAn independent learner and willing to challenge existing work processesAble to demonstrate how you manage your time effectively and multi-taskAn analytical and critical thinker, able to resolve problems through an organized thought processComfortable learning from others, but also sharing your own knowledge and ideasCarry out tasks complying to Code of EthicsHappy to build your own networks to learn from the technical expertise around youCreative in your approach to problem solving to ensure our machines are betterPassionate about Dyson and our technology to help us meet our future planBenefitsProfessional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops
And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:We are looking for a Data Scientist who will support our products, ecommerce, customer, advertising, media contents, and other divisions in Astro and assist leadership with the insights gained from analyzing company wide and related data
What You DoThe ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action

They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations
They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights
They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams
The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes
Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting and other business outcomes
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy

Number of significant innovations implemented with a positive impact to profitability, cost savings, brand or customer experienceREQUIREMENTS:Who Are YouWe’re looking for someone with 5 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a Master’s or PHD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative fieldKnowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, SLQ, etc
Experience using web services: Redshift, S3, Spark, , etc

Experiences over Big Data platform like AWS, Azure, quboleExperience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc
Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers: Google Analytics etcExperience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Tableau, D3, ggplot, etc
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, Spark, SLQ, etc
) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc
) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc
) and experience with applications
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Strong problem solving skills
