Job Description and QualificationsPOSITION SUMMARYPurposeThe position is responsible for daily operation and monitoring of H2 plant and N2 Gen Gas plant and H2 filling of merchant unit
The incumbent shall follow work instruction for start up/shutdown plant
supply hydrogen gas and nitrogen gas to customer with specified quality and maintain/improve the plant reliability

Nature and ScopeThe job holder is reporting to Plant Engineer or Production LeadThe job holder is required to perform the tasks as per the (Basic Safety Process) BSP definition and ensure the H2 plant and N2 Gen Gas plant operating and maintain in a safely manner
The job holder is in charge on day to day operation, which includes startup, shutdown, plant capacity adjustment and optimize the plant operation
He/she requires to assist plant engineer on the plant troubleshooting
The person is also required to fill the H2 tube trailer on day to day basis
The person requires to perform documentation work and necessary transaction on the tube trailer filling
The job holder is requiring to be qualified as safe work permit issuer
He/she require to issue permit when there is a requirement
The job holder is required to perform water analysis and chemical test on boiler water daily
If any deviation is detected, the job holder is required to report to plant engineer in timely basis
The job holder is responsible of overall housekeeping in the plant
He/She need to work with internal staff or contractors to ensure plant housekeeping is always maintained at satisfactory condition
The job holder is required to liaise with customer’s control room for day-to-day routine plant operation
The job holder is responsible for day to day operation of N2 Gen gas plant which include routine inspection, startup and shutdown
He/she is required to carry out other duties/assignments under instruction of he/her superior
PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIESMake safe operation of the plant as per relevant procedures and check sheets

Make record and document plant equipment dataTo check daily plant operating condition and analyzes for defect/abnormality for H2 plant and N2 Gen Gas plantProvide routine and some non-routine data analyses on plant dataCarry out preventive maintenance programs including equipment monitoring condition for all equipment in the plant
To participate in plant turnaround maintenance activities, plant startup and shutdown
To report any abnormalities in plant operating condition/issues to shift supervisor/plant engineerTo generate daily production reportsTo record and collate data for monthly production reports
Responsible for plant safety equipment inspection as delegated by superiorTo ensure proper housekeeping and safety measures are carried out
To follow all the ISO 9001:2015 procedures
To refill hydrogen tube trailers, cylinders and pallets requested by superiors and perform product analysis as well as oil detection using UV light as per relevant procedures
To ensure no visible oil carryover to tube trailer/cylinder/pallets/H2 pipeline by carry out periodic maintenance such as oil draining, oil top up, lube oil drop adjustment etc

To collect data and prepare monthly maintenance report of designated equipmentTo participate in housekeeping and safety activities like BSP which are organized by plant management including plant ERT team
To perform regular machinery condition monitoring [i
vibration check, temperature, sound check, oil top up, oil replacement, greasing etc

], assess their reliability and inform plant engineer/manager of any abnormalities To be responsible for proper and schedule maintenance / repairs procedures / operations have been carried out and documentation been filled up and kept
To carry out periodic preventive maintenance on plant, pipeline
Practice good housekeeping at customer site, workshop and plant areas and follow safety practices
To be responsible for daily plant maintenance (schedule/breakdown) so that plant downtime is kept at a minimum

To perform other duties as instructed by superior· ·MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONSTechnical Diploma in mechanical/chemical or fresh graduateSPM (Vocational/Technical School) with Minimum 2 years working experience in plant processComputer literate with basic MS Windows and Office knowledgeReq No

Position: Science Communications Specialist Location: Penang (Malaysia-HQ) or remote home-based in similar time zone Application Deadline: 21 April 2021 Post level: Open to qualified national and international applicants Type of contract: 1 year fixed term with possibility of renewal Language(s) required: English (high proficiency in verbal and written communication) ABOUT WORLDFISH WorldFish is a nonprofit research and innovation institution that creates, advances and translates scientific research on aquatic food systems into scalable solutions with transformational impact on human well-being and the environment
We envision an inclusive world of healthy, well-nourished people and a sustainable blue planet, now and in the future

We are part of One CGIAR, the world’s largest agricultural innovation network, whose mission is to “end hunger by 2030 through science to transform food, land and water systems under threat of climate change

” Our research and innovation work spans climate change, food security and nutrition, sustainable fisheries and aquaculture, the blue economy and ocean governance, OneHealth, genetics and AgriTech, and it integrates evidence and perspectives on gender, youth and social inclusion
Our purpose is to accelerate the sustainable transformation of global food systems toward nutritious diets that sustain the health of people and the planet
Our research data, evidence and insights shape better practices, policies and investment decisions for sustainable development in low- and middle-income countries

As a networked organization embedded in a larger innovation ecosystem of partners, including One CGIAR, our model of operation and beyond is guided by our values that stand for Learning, Excellence, Accountability and Diversity (LEAD)

We have a global presence across 20 countries in Asia, Africa and the Pacific with 460 staff of 30 nationalities deployed where the greatest sustainable development challenges can be addressed through holistic aquatic food systems solutions
ABOUT THE ROLE We are looking for an enthusiastic and results-driven Science Communication Specialist to join our busy and dynamic Communications and Marketing team at the WorldFish headquarters

If you are passionate about working with world-class scientists and engaging with different policymakers, donors and development practitioners to inform and influence the global sustainable development agenda - through scientific evidence and innovative solutions - on issues as diverse as climate change, sustainable ocean governance and inclusive blue growth, food and nutrition security, poverty and livelihoods, gender equality and environmental sustainability, then this is the job for you

Your job is to translate scientific and technical research outputs into influential and accessible communications pieces that successfully engage various audiences of WorldFish, and advance critical evidence-based narratives related to the 2030 WorldFish Research and Innovation Strategy (link here) and our mission ‘to end hunger and advance the SGDs by 2030 through science and innovation to transform food, land and water systems with aquatic foods for healthier people and planet

” Day-to-day, you will be responsible for developing and delivering quality content featured on our main communications channels and platforms (print and digital) and work across teams to ensure messaging is consistent across our channels and brand

Longer-term projects will involve implementing best practices across WorldFish, experimenting with new content types on existing and new communication channels, as well as supporting the larger Communications and Marketing team to create compelling content and strategic communications campaigns for papers, special events, thought leadership, and WorldFish-wide initiatives
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR

You must have a strong foundation in all aspects of evidence-based communications for a science and/or development organization, reflected in your progressive experience with strategic planning, development and implementation of complex communication projects and activities, including high-level conferenced and global events
Moreover, you are a digital native with experience working both strategically and tactically with different digital tools – ideally applying omni-channel approaches
You love to think and plan strategically, and more so you to get going with effective execution
You understand what it takes to create messaging and design processes that engage target audiences
You can grasp complex concepts and structures quickly and can think on your feet
Excellent customer service and relations come naturally to you, and your top-notch interpersonal skills enable you to work well with different people, as well as inspire and motivate them
Most importantly, you are structured and well-organized, and able to handle multiple issues and shifting priorities with ease

This is a challenging and exciting role for a stellar communicator with strong writing skills, excellent networking abilities and an incurable intellectual curiosity to always learn and push yourself outside of the comfort zone
You must be passionate about science and communications and have a knack for seizing opportunities
You have a proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects and people across different regions and time-zones, as well different functions and disciplines
Your results-driven work ethic and your approach to constant learning and innovation sets the bar for others to deliver high-quality results time and again

You have a flair for bringing out the best in multidisciplinary teams operating in complex research programs and the multicultural setting of an international organization, and more importantly you know how to build trust, enable effective teamwork and exceed the expectations of key customers, audiences and partners of WorldFish

KEY REQUIREMENTS This job might be for you if you have the following skills and qualifications: At least 5 years of professional experience in a communications role with a scientific research institution (public or private), international PR/media/Development Communications firm, development agency and/or science philanthropic foundation
Educated to Master’s degree level in Science Communications, Journalism, Marketing and/or scientific discipline that is relevant to WorldFish’s work
Genuine interest in and strong commitment to WorldFish’s vision, mission, value and objectives and the ability to professionally advocate our positions from a solid scientific base

Strong writing and editorial skills (in English) with evidence of proven ability to translate complex scientific work into accessible, engaging and impactful communications content for print and digital publication and distribution
Evidence of strong ability to digest, critically analyze and present complex scientific information clearly and concisely in a wide variety of formats for non-scientific audiences

Experience with and a strong understanding of how print and digital media work, including omni-channel marketing approaches to place and promote science in newspapers, TV, radio, podcasts, targeted e-marketing, social and digital media promotion (YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Flickr, Instagram), etc
Proven ability to connect individual communications activities, initiatives and products to higher-level organizational strategies and goals, and strategize at both macro and micro levels
High level of independence and can-do mentality, strong time and priority management, and an ability to make sound decisions in highly pressured environments
Proven ability to work well under pressure with diverse teams scattered across different time zones and geographies, and to manage complex content production processes and schedules
Experience with helping to coordinate and organize global and national events (virtually and face-to-face)
Team player and natural collaborator with high levels of self-motivation, drive for excellence, attention to details, and used to working flexibly at a fast pace

Proven ability to manage competing priorities and projects, and work patiently and astutely with different groups of internal and external stakeholders in a multicultural, multilingual and virtual environment
RECRUITMENT PROCESS The position will be based in either Penang, Malaysia or remote home-based in similar time zone
Flexible working arrangements can be considered
Interviews are expected to be held by end of April 2021
Shortlisted candidate will be notified and expected to undergo a written assessment and attend a virtual interview

The successful candidate should be available to commence as soon as possible for an initial of one (1) year fixed term contract, with the possibility of contract renewal depending on performance and funding available
WorldFish is an international, non-for-profit research organization that works to reduce hunger, malnutrition and poverty by improving fisheries and aquaculture

With a 45-years track record of leading-edge science, WorldFish generates research evidence and innovations to inform sustainable practices and inclusive policies that enable better livelihoods and healthier diets for millions of poor people, particularly women, who depend on fish for food, nutrition and income
WorldFish is a member of CGIAR , the world’s largest global partnership on agriculture research and innovation for a food secure future
Headquartered in Penang, Malaysia and with regional offices across Africa, Asia and the Pacific, WorldFish leads the cross-disciplinary CGIAR Research Program (CRP) on Fish Agri-Food Systems (FISH)

Job DescriptionNielsen is building talent pipelines to meet future hiring demand
This is a pipeline role, while there is not an immediate opening, we want to build relationships with prospective candidates like you
If your background is a match to our requirements, we’ll follow up with the exploratory conversation
ABOUT THIS JOBAs the world's largest research organization, Nielsen IQ is powered by talented creative scientists
Our Data Scientist Business Leaders come from diverse disciplines such as statistics, research methodology, mathematics, psychology, business, engineering, physics and demography
These professionals drive innovation, new product ideation, develops complex analysis and delivery of data insights to measure what consumers buy
RESPONSIBILITIESOwn Data Science solutions for client requests and provide initial recommendations for complex client raised issues
Support Internal and External Clients with the understanding of Data Science design and methodology
Accompanied senior leaders meet with clients to understand business needs and help offer innovative solutions
Work on creating new solutions use cases, proof of concept and prototypes by exploring diverse data sets using tools such as python/r
Understand Nielsen products and services to suggest new solutions for client challenges
Collaborate with other Data Science team units
Automate and develop solutions for existing processes
Innovate and create out of the box solutions by leveraging large and diverse data sets and state of the art technologies
A LITTLE BIT ABOUT YOUYou’ve dabbled in data
You’ve perused Python
And you have the communication chops to translate it all into conversation or presentations
While you’ve worked with global cross-functional teams, you can also put your head down and focus on independent projects
Seeing the big picture takes attention to detail
Keeping up with the fast-changing world of digital media measurement takes someone who recognizes that
You know what’s happening in big data and you’re ready to influence what’s next
QualificationsProfessionals with degrees in Maths, Data Science, Statistics, or related fields involving statistical analysis of large data sets
0-3 years of experience in market research or relevant field
Solid understanding of Statistics
Good aptitude for data analysis
Critical/ logical thinking
Experienced with programming languages such as Python and R
Familiar with contemporary database systems
Passionate about innovation and technologyProblem-Solving skillsAbility to effectively convey complex concepts to non-expertsWorking knowledge with data visualization tools (e

Spotfire, Tableau, etc) and mapping tools would be a plusWorking knowledge with collaboration tools such as Google Suite(Googlesite, Google Data Studio), Atlassian, Git, Bitbucket and Confluence would be a plusFamiliar with Machine LearningFamiliarity with marketing analytics, including designing experiments and consumer behavior analysis
Additional InformationAbout NielsenIQNielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide

We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow
Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge
We like to be in the middle of the action
That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population
For more information, visit www
NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce

ID: 276923The successful candidate will reproduce electrical failures in a lab environment and locate/characterize he defect or anomaly using a variety of electrical, optical, and physical techniques
Collaboration is expected with experts within the FA lab and other organizations, e
, Design, Test, and Manufacturing
FA results will be documented in formal failure analysis reports

Analysis techniques will involve a range of approaches including: rigorous analysis of the device on evaluation boards (EVBs), detailed in-circuit probing to examine signal behavior & deprocessing of the packaged device in order to identify the cause of failure
In addition many advanced tools such as Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM), 3D Xray and EMMI are used in the investigation, isolation and identification of problems

The following is the BASIC job knowledge/requirementsEngineering BS or MS degree aligned with Electric/Electronics or Applied PhysicsGood technical knowledge of digital and analog circuit fundamentals as well as an understanding of the underlying semiconductor device physics and behaviour
Lab bench testing using evaluation boards, lab tester and electrical test data interpretation
Understanding of semiconductor wafer processing
Specific experience of microcontrollers and their operation would be an advantage
Knowledge of common computer software packages, such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc…Knowledge of UNIX, CADENCE and KNIGHTS software is desirable
Ability to work with chemicals, X-Ray, Electron and Ion Beam ToolThe following job experience would be a benefit/plus (but not requirement)
Laboratory or wafer fab or similar manufacturing environment is a plusMicroprobe measurement and analysis/test measurement knowledge
Familiar with the FA process flow and analysis techniques: SEM, EDX, X-ray, etc
Ability to de-process devices using a variety of wet and dry chemistry methodologies
Strong problem solving skills, (e
, 8D or similar practice) attention to detail, good communication skills (both written and verbal) and the ability to produce quality results in a timely fashion are also essential attributes

About UsLondon Stock Exchange Group (LSE
L) is a diversified international market infrastructure and capital markets business sitting at the heart of the world's financial community
The Group can trace its history back to 1698
The Group operates a broad range of international equity, bond and derivatives markets, including London Stock Exchange
Borsa Italiana
MTS, Europe's leading fixed income market
and Turquoise, a pan-European equities MTF
It is also home to one of the world’s leading growth markets for SMEs, AIM
Through its platforms, the Group offers international business and investors unrivalled access to Europe's capital markets
Post trade and risk management services are a significant part of the Group’s business operations
In addition to majority ownership of multi-asset global CCP operator, LCH Group, LSEG operates CC&G, the Italian clearing house
Monte Titoli, the T2S-ready European settlement business
and globeSettle, the Group’s newly established CSD based in Luxembourg
The Group is a global leader in indexing and analytic solutions
FTSE Russell offers thousands of indexes that measure and benchmark markets around the world
The Group also provides customers with an extensive range of real time and reference data products, including SEDOL, UnaVista, and RNS
London Stock Exchange Group is a leading developer of high performance trading platforms and capital markets software for customers around the world
In addition to the Group’s own markets, over 35 other organisations and exchanges use the Group’s MillenniumIT trading, surveillance and post trade technology
Headquartered in London, with significant operations in North America, Italy, France and Sri Lanka, the Group employs approximately 4,700 people

We’re looking to hire a Community Manager to join us at Comfort Works to work on all sorts of fun, meaningful marketing projects
We’re accepting applications for the next 2 weeks with a start date of early February
About the role and the work:We are looking for a high energy community and social media specialist to join our Marketing team in our KL Headquarters
You will be responsible for creating engagement, building the super fan community, and boosting brand awareness on all our social media platforms
This is a position that requires humor, resourcefulness, grace, fast reflexes, patience, and empathy
You understand that “on the Internet”, nothing is truly deleted so we try to put our best foot forward, always

This role is for someone who is excited to work with Customer Experience Agents, Marketers, Product Managers, and Data Specialists to deep dive into customer personas & behaviors in order to build on content strategy and generate inbound traffic
You will need to be enthusiastic, curious, and organized, as your responsibilities will include customer and community research, image selection, writing, and social media management
You will be expected to manage our social presence and to create new social community channels like Reddit
You will also be expected to chat, call, or hang out where our customers are hanging out so that you gain a deeper understanding of who you are creating content and building communities for
Because you will be so visible (virtually, anyway) you will be held to high standards
This position is an opportunity for someone who is eager to learn and grow in their career
Someone who proactively reaches out to groups, organizations, other brands we should be partnering with and fielding sponsorship opportunities that come our way

It's built for someone who is able to recognize an opportunity when they see one, able to make a business case to get buy-ins from stakeholders but knows how to steer clear of high effort low reward mirages
Someone who is able to keep an eye on the analytics and measure the effectiveness of the user-generated content
Someone who is able to marry the impact of the community to the organization's goals
If you do not know how yet, we will be here to coach you
In addition to big picture strategy and community engagement, you’ll be working on practical day-to-day work like responding to comments and customer queries in a timely manner
We value efficiency, conscientiousness, and creativity
You will be expected to monitor and engage with customers on online review sites
We don’t simply take problems “offline”, we are a team that lives to truly resolve people’s issues and concerns
You will be working closely with the Customer Experience team by escalating and resolving product and service problems, creating new products or processes along the way
About you:You’re creative
You’re organized
You’re experienced
You love our brand and what we stand for
You have a love for writing, a passion for storytelling and concept creation, a soft spot for interior design, and a fascination with technology
You have a great eye for design and are aware of and follow other tastemakers and influencers
You are not afraid of data and analytics
You are hungry, humble, and human smart
You value quality and consistency when it comes to working
You’re most likely a cat person
You are known for your humor and empathy- even through tough complex human problems
We value people who can take a stand yet commit to kindness even when they disagree
And understand the value of others being heard
Charging the trust battery between us and our community is part of the work
And it's part of our culture of mutual trust and respect
You may also have a stack of design, food, and travel blogs/ Pinterest boards/ Twitter accounts you’re just dying for us to check out too
We’re hoping you also have completely unrelated hobbies that will make us love you even more
About us:Comfort Works is challenging the upholstery industry on a global scale
We are privately owned and never had outside funding, so we don’t answer to anyone by ourselves and our customers
We’re committed generalists, conscientious workers, and believers in doing what's right and what's essential
No heroics
This job is not about moving heaven and earth
Yes, we want to be proud of running a globally competitive business (our business continues to grow even in a pandemic) but we also want to be kind, considerate, fair, flexible, and calm
Especially in a crisis
We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply
Our team is 50% Malaysians and 50% Expats
Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company
We are quick to trust
We will open our books, our stories, and share our knowledge with you
We are kind to each other
We reach for responsibility and hold ourselves accountable
We show up for the work and for each other
You can expect a team that listens and for you to be heard
You can expect to grow in your strengths, versatility, and competence in this job
You can expect an inclusive, eager team who’ll support you in it, rise to challenges with you and grow together
We subject ideas to rigorous consideration and challenge each other, but all remember that we’re here for the same purpose: to do good work together
We’re in this for the long haul
Comfort Works is based in Damansara Heights
We work from a house, not an office
We are semi-remote mainly because we believe in having face-to-face reviews, retrospectives, and refinements while intentionally setting aside “alone time” to excel in your own work
We’re all about reasonable working hours, ample flexible vacation time, wellness, education, and putting humans before policies first
We are committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career
How to apply:Please submit an application that speaks directly to this position
Tell us about yourself, about what you can bring to Comfort Works, and about this role in your future
Tell us about what you’ve done and what excites you
About Comfort Works:Comfort Works aims to breathe new life into all of the world’s living room
we do it by creating beautiful, handmade slipcovers that rejuvenate old and tired sofas
Every aspect of our operation is done in-house: from envelope design to web development to product manufacturing, nothing is outsourced

Comfort Works is where designers, geeks, writers, number crunchers, marketers, analysts, strategists, cat people, dog people, human people, manga lovers, movie lovers, gamers, introverts, extroverts and innovators who dream outside the box come together to help their fellow humans fall in love with their homes
over and over again
We design with the belief that we can live simple and beautiful by trying to revive the hidden potential of our old furniture and doing our part for the planet
Before we knew it, Comfort Works expanded into a huge range of products specializing in IKEA sofa covers, custom furniture slipcovers and other complementary accessories

The Data Engineer reports directly to the Head of Enterprise Data Lake
You will be contributing strongly to the development and maintenance of our Enterprise Data Lake, which is an integral part of Hilti digital transformation agenda

Who is Hilti
We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector

What does the role involve
In your role as a Data Engineer, you are responsible for the development, maintenance and improvement of all the data flows in the enterprise data lake built on AWS cloud platform

You interact directly with various stakeholders (business users, data scientists, analytics teams) to understand their data demand and in turn, design and develop scalable ETL packages from the business source systems, including development of ETL routines, to bring these data into the data lake
You integrate new data sources (internal and external) by creating end to end data pipelines from ingestion to consumption
You are responsible to perform thorough testing and validation to support accuracy of data transformations and data consistency
You resolve production issues related to data interfaces and ETL/ELT processes in a timely manner
You assess the stability, robustness and efficiency of implemented data pipelines and implement continuous improvement initiatives
In this position, you will lead innovation through exploration, benchmarking, and sharing best practices in big data framework and technologies

Senior Engineer, Firmware Engineering Location: KL COE, Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia Western Digital® We deliver the possibilities of data
YOU define what’s possible
What We Do We are focused on design and development of next generation firmware architecture and algorithms to deliver high performance and cost-efficient enterprise Hard Disk Drive (eHDD) products
As part of the globally diverse R&D team, you will be working in an Agile development environment with opportunity to learn and grow in multiple disciplines
We want our firmware engineers to be enthusiastic, creative and adaptive in taking on problems, because they are empowered to think and act like owners
Innovation has always fueled and nurtured growth at Western Digital
As trusted engineers and innovators, helping solve the world’s biggest challenges energizes us and gives us purpose
This position is based in Western Digital Tech and Regional Center (M), which is a Center of Excellence located in Petaling Jaya, Malaysia
What You Will Do ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: • Design, develop, test, integrate and maintain quality firmware for eHDD using best practices like unit test, CI and Agile methodologies
• Design and implementation of data structures, software algorithms, data path, and drivers for hardware cores using latest standards C++ and Python
• Participate in Scrum & Agile processes to bring up new hardware and develop embedded firmware for data storage products
• Deliver cutting-edge storage products with SAS, SATA, PCIE interfaces
• Collaborate and design solutions for the challenging yet unique problems across hardware and software platforms, including servers, RAID, and various operating systems (Windows and Linux)
• Participate in planning and coordinating significant technical investigations from problem statement to conclusions
• Create design documents pertinent to the various phases of firmware development
Qualifications REQUIRED SKILLS • Bachelor or Master in Computer Science, Computer/Electronics Engineering or equivalent required
• Knowledge in C/C++, object-oriented programming, Python, data structures, algorithms
• Capable of quickly learning new firmware, hardware, systems, tools, and methodologies
• Ability to effectively manage projects and tasks to deliver deadlines and commitments
• You have high degree of problem solving skills, solutions oriented with a positive, can-do attitude
• You have excellent interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communication
• You are comfortable and enjoy working in a dynamic and ever evolving environment
• You can be a fun and enthusiastic teammate who enjoys challenges and celebrates successes
DESIRED SKILLS and/or EXPERIENCE • Familiarity with micro-controller architecture (ARM or ARC), embedded systems and RTOS desired
• Knowledge in SAS, SATA and PCIE interface
• Experience in the use of bus analyzers, emulators and other firmware debugging tools will be an added advantage
• Possess data analytics skillset such as machine learning

• Working experience as a Scrum Master or understanding of Agile practices will be an added advantage About WESTERN DIGITAL Western Digital Corporation is the world’s largest data storage company with a leading portfolio of HGST, SanDisk, G-Technology and WD brands covering flash and disk-based solutions
Deployed by the largest and most prominent organizations worldwide, Western Digital solutions are everywhere, touching lives and enabling great value from the data they possess
Western Digital - A Storage Solutions Leader Western Digital is a company with strong values and a passion to innovate and lead the charge in the transformation of data

Always SimpleThe Role ResponsibilitiesPurpose:The Operational Continuity in Resolution department ensures SCB maintains compliance with regulatory guidelines by maintaining a service catalogue codifying the SCB Group’s operating model and enabling continued demonstration of resilience and resolvability
OCIR is a critical element of the broader Recovery & Resolution Planning regulations mandated by the G20’s Financial Stability Board

In the unlikely event of Standard Chartered entering a state of Resolution, the OCIR initiative aims to ensure the orderly wind-down and/or break-up of the group, minimising impact to the real economy

Think iPrice
Southeast Asia is seen as the e-commerce haven, where new online stores are popping up every day
As such, shoppers are faced with more and more websites in their search for what they want and engage with retailers online
All this can get a little confusing
With this in mind, iPrice was set up to offer shoppers the widest selection of products and brands, provided by hundreds of partners in Southeast Asia – all made available on one shopping website
No more having to search through the plethora of websites
Going through many different websites often takes time
iPrice recognized the importance of saving time and money and has provided shoppers the benefit of comparing prices of products from its partners
Other useful information like delivery time and costs, payment options and good coupon deals are also readily available
iPrice has in place a stringent selection process of acquiring partners in order to offer shoppers high quality and reliable partners
This is to ensure that online purchases are made in a safe environment
With a click of a button, the avid shopper can now search for products, compare prices and save with great deals – all in one safe shopping site

Our Mission To bring a greater level of transparency, convenience and trust to the e-commerce market in Southeast Asia by making it easy for shoppers to compare prices, discover products and get the best deals from thousands of online shopsMaster's or Equivalent

Company DescriptionAbout Avery DennisonAvery Dennison (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science company specializing in the design and manufacture of a wide variety of labeling and functional materials
The company’s products, which are used in nearly every major industry, include pressure-sensitive materials for labels and graphic applications
tapes and other bonding solutions for industrial, medical, and retail applications
tags, labels and embellishments for apparel
and radio frequency identification (RFID) solutions serving retail apparel and other markets
Headquartered in Glendale, California, the company employs more than 30,000 employees in over 50 countries
Reported sales in 2019 were $7
1 billion
Learn more at www
comAbout Avery Dennison Intelligent LabelsBuilt on a legacy of innovation and materials science, Avery Dennison has embarked on a new era of opportunity
This is an opportunity to take the functional and traditional label and enable it with digital technologies that can give every item a unique digital identity and digital life
This “intelligence applied” technology has the capability to enable a world of connected everything
A world where the 'who, what and where' of every physical, become points of irrefutable fact and absolute visibility
Provenance, authenticity, sourcing, history, real-time location
guaranteed for businesses and consumers throughout the entire supply chain and all the way to the home
At its most simple, a company with a legacy in “making labels” becomes a category-leading technology company making the Internet of Things a positive, transformative, world-wide reality for all of us
The label has always told us something about the product
Now it can tell us everything
In February 2020, Avery Dennison acquired Smartrac, a leading manufacturer of RFID products

Combined with the Intelligent Labels business, we will leverage our deep industry knowledge and know-how in technology and innovation, R&D, quality and service to drive RFID and technology adoption across multiple industries
And we want you to be part of our journey

Deutsche Bank Analyst Internship Programme – IB: FIC Sales, Trading & Structuring - MalaysiaLocation:About Deutsche Bank Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network
We’re driving growth through our strong client franchise

Against a backdrop of increasing globalization in the world economy, Deutsche Bank is very well-positioned, with significant regional diversification and substantial revenue streams from all the major regions of the world
We serve our clients’ real economic needs in commercial banking, investment banking, private banking and asset management
We are investing heavily in digital technologies, prioritizing long term success over short-term gains, and serving society with ambition and integrity
All this means a career packed with opportunities to grow and the chance to shape the future of our clients
The Deutsche Bank Internship Programme An internship at Deutsche Bank is your stepping stone to success and your first look into what life is like on our Graduate Programme

You’ll become part of a collaborative and inclusive workplace as you build on your technical and interpersonal skills, take on real responsibilities, hear from senior leadership through our speaker series, work on live projects, grow your network and learn first-hand how we deliver for our clients
If you want the opportunity to shape your own career as well as the future of the financial industry, then we will give you the platform and foundation to do so
Successful interns will be invited to join the Deutsche Bank Graduate Programme

About Investment Bank: Fixed Income & Currencies (FIC) Fixed Income & Currencies (FIC) brings together a top-ranked institutional sales force, world-class research with trading and structuring expertise across Foreign Exchange, Rates, Credit and Emerging Markets

The Fixed Income & Currencies business enables Deutsche Bank to respond to increasing automation, regulatory expectations and client demand for standardisation and transparency in execution across fixed income, currency and emerging markets
Foreign Exchange:Deutsche Bank is an industry recognised leader in the foreign exchange business

Our client centric approach helps us to serve the needs of our customers across the full product spectrum from basic liquidity provision in the spot market to innovative derivative solutions for both asset and liability managers
Rates:Deutsche Bank’s Rates business provides a comprehensive range of fixed income securities and OTC derivatives
We give clients access to the Bank’s liquidity and product expertise through our global sales, trading and structuring teams, as well as our electronic trading channels and clearing offering
Our product range includes Government, Agency and Mortgage-Backed Securities (MBS) as well as a suite of interest rate and inflation derivative products
Credit:Deutsche Bank’s global Credit trading business enables clients to meet their investment objectives and manage credit risk
With industry-leading expertise in market-making and credit valuation, we offer clients a wide range of products across Flow Credit, Distressed Products and Structured Finance Trading
Products traded include bonds, loans and claims, ranging from the strongest investment grade issuers through high yield to distressed assets
Our Structured Finance experts provide structured risk and non-flow financing solutions for clients across multiple industries and asset classes
Emerging Markets:Deutsche Bank’s emerging markets business offers a fully-integrated and global product platform
With unrivalled breadth and superior execution capabilities, we are dedicated to making markets and providing client solutions in a wide range of EM products
Our product range includes external debt and Credit Default Swaps (CDS), FX, rates, options and the more complex cross-market derivatives covering multiple EM jurisdictions
Division specifics about the internship role Our interns are given the opportunity to learn about our business from different viewpoints, giving you a career advantage
Starting with up to a week of training, you’ll then complete up to four rotations
These will depend on your interests, your location and the needs of our business but you can be sure you'll gain a real understanding of the work we do
Your day-to-day tasks will vary depending on your role and the desk you’re working on
In FIC you might be pricing products for traders, preparing financial data analysis or refining the way we do forecasts
In Institutional & Treasury Coverage you may be preparing marketing materials for clients or helping to liaise with clients
Whichever areas you experience, the internship is an ideal way of finding out whether a career in these businesses meets your needs and aspirations

Areas in which you could work:• Fixed Income & Currencies (Trading & Structuring)• Institutional & Treasury Coverage (Sales)What we look for We recruit highly intelligent interns who are ambitious and adaptable
They have degrees in many different disciplines
Even though good levels of numeracy are important for some roles, you won’t necessarily need a formal mathematical or financial background
We have very comprehensive training programmes that will give you all the technical knowledge you’ll need to build a career with us
Above all, we’re looking for entrepreneurial people who thrive best in a diverse culture where innovation and agile thinking abound
You should not only be passionate about the world of finance, but also show a keen interest in your chosen field
You already have a record of outstanding academic achievement and you’re eager to go on learning at the same intensive rate
So you’ll thrive on working in a highly collaborative environment with some of the best minds in banking
Open to students graduating between August 2021 to July 2022

Job DescriptionThe Production Engineer (Shift) leads and develops associates in the shift

The role drives the successful delivery of all key activities in the shift related to producing the demand requested by Planning and supply, Safety Health and Environment - SHE, quality, labour allocation, optimized cost and production execution
The Shift Leader develops a culture of ownership in the team with high action orientation and commitment for results which delivers manufacturing excellence

Delivers the shift contributes to the Compelling Business Need - CBN, long term (Value Creation Plan - VCP) and mid-term (Annual Operations Plan - AOP) plans cascaded from the area strategy which continuously over-delivers on company goals
Safety Health and Environment:Delivers a Safety Health and Environment culture and role model behaviours

Responsible for Safety Health and Environment requirements and legislation implementation and complies to legal and corporate standards & policiesInstructs employees regarding job-related hazards and corresponding safety procedures

Checks if (new) employees and temporary workers possess sufficient skills and knowledge to execute the job safelySupervises employees to ensure they follow the safety instructions and work safely & orderly using as an example Lock Out Tag Out Test Out – LOTOTO and permit to work – PTW
Immediately corrects any substandard condition or unsafe behaviour
Encourages feedback routine between peers through using applicable tools such as Behaviour Observation Safety – BOS

Checks that this is done to the required standardEnsures safe machine and work conditions, as well as availability Personal Protective Equipment – PPE and necessary safety tools at the start of every shift
Participates in the Risk Assessment process as requiredChecks if a work permit is adequate and execution is according to plan

takes care of technician’s / contractor’s and third-party employees safety during shiftReports unsafe situations and ensures adequate corrective measures are being taken on timeEnsures that the workplace is safe, clean and well ordered
Makes proposals to improve workplace safetyStops work when safety is at risk

Escalates with sufficient anticipation what capacity and support are required to get the job done safelyReviews Safety performance as part of the daily Operations Performance meetings Structure - OPSCreate a Safe and Healthy work environment by leading incident investigations and escalation of unsafe conditions and behaviours
Escalates and implement solutions to impact risks in ergonomics and working conditions
Quality:Delivers a Quality culture and role model behaviours
Responsible for Quality requirements and legislation implementation and complies to legal and corporate standards & policies
Leadership:Drives manufacturing excellence within the shift team through engaged leadership and coaching
Develops and coaches the associates in the team to close the competency gap
Implement Manufacturing Operating System - MOS roll out plan with a hands-on approach through using and owning the relevant tools
Builds an excellent and effective shift team

Leadership:Leads and role models output of Manufacturing Operating System - MOS supporting roll-out and further development with a hands-on approachDrive zero loss, defects and 100% engagement culture by leveraging continuous improvement approachFinding the correct resources to build competency in the shift team and ensures appropriate training is applied for new/improved processes when rolled outAudits consistency of competency and processes in the teamsDelivery & Cost:Takes full responsibility for shift losses and shift performance and creates a strong understanding of the team's contribution to the Compelling Business Need – CBN
Execute the daily processes and labour to deliver the production plan
Identifies areas of best practice and collaborates with other shifts to generate, replicate and share with stakeholders
Creates standards

Updates relevant information, tracking and reporting systems

Minimum of 3 years experience in manufacturing environment (strong preference in Fast Moving Consumer Goods)Team player, able to work in a small team

As the Senior Mechanical Engineer, you will develop cutting edge equipment and machinery for the breeding and farming of insects
You will be able to bring ideas to life and translate concepts into machine designs, ready for fabrication and farm operation
The goal is to roll out a series of Smart Insect Farms starting next year, supported by elegant and robust system, process and machine engineering and cutting-edge automation systems
You will be a key member of the engineering team developing the factory blueprint from our existing pilot farm
Job Description:Design equipment and tools to monitor, handle and support processes around all lifecycle stages of our insect as well as material movement and processing plant machinery
Design wizard - You create designs using CAD software (AutoCAD 2D and SolidWorks 3D), analyzing the data from the tests, prototyping and iteratively optimizing towards full-scale implementation
Receive and study feedback from various teams about equipment and machinery, your job is to think of design solutions, and improve them
Leading Design for Manufacturing & Assembly (DFMA) and Design to Cost initiatives to develop a scalable and reproducible smart farm model
Eye for detail to ensure measurements are correct to avoid operational errors or difficulties due to design
Requirements:Min 5 years in managing mechanical engineering in manufacturing environment
Understanding of manufacturing, fabrication and assembly of large-scale machine, processing lines as well as delicate automation machines and robotics
You communicate effectively and confidently in written and spoken English
Expert skill in SolidWorks, AutoCAD and other design software
excellent spatial and quantitative thinking
Strong technical intuition
Multi-disciplinary curiosity, keen observer and quick learner
You can have a conversation with our business, biology and operational teams to deeply understand requirements, expectations and constraints to design elegant solutions
Manage your projects' timelines, cost and scope for high quality deliverables
Strong attention to detail and high work standards
Pro-active and independent thinking and problem-solving competence
Preferred: Impressive portfolio of designing, planning and fabricating novel machines
What you should expect from us:Competitive compensation
No red tape
no useless corporate admin work and endless meetings
A dynamic, friendly, diverse and fast-growing team
A high-growth, agritech and biotech startup environment

Job OverviewForensic & Malware Security Analyst is responsible for the investigation, protection and recovery of information from computers and storage devices
and use both static and dynamic tools/techniques to analyze and reverse-engineer malware during security incident investigations
They will also be also responsible for following all safety and privacy procedures when handling sensitive and confidential information such as documents, videos, or pictures
The Forensic & Malware Engineer hey will be responsible for the gathering, handling and documenting evidence so that chain of custody and accuracy is maintained whilst performing their duties
Roles and ResponsibilitiesPrimary Duties:Support the incident triage process through the examination and analysis of digital evidence and artefacts
Use a variety of tools to investigate incidents and take immediate action or recommend a course of action to safeguard the system

Coordinate and collaborate with the Intrusion Detection and Incident Response Teams to assist in the containment, eradication and recovery of incidents, and facilitate the development of new signatures and indicators to prevent future attacks against the system

Conduct immediate host-based and network-based forensic examinations and Malware reverse engineering on security incidents as they arise to determine the root cause and to reconstruct a timeline of events to facilitate incident response and recovery
Conduct malware analysis and reverse engineering as directed in a safe and secure environment

Conduct forensic collection and analysis of all supported devices, including but not limited to Linux, Windows, and Apple workstations, servers, as well as IOS and Android mobile devices, both online and offline, in support of the SOC Incident Response process
Coordinate and provide direct support to the incident response process utilizing forensic information to support incident response and recovery
Document all communications and actions in the SOC ticketing system in response to assigned incidents
Perform appropriate event escalation for events, notifications, and alerts
Utilize leading forensic tools such as EnCase, FTK, CloudStrike, SANS SIFT and other systems as required
Generate forensic reports and synopses presenting complex technical processes and findings clearly and concisely to technical and non-technical audiences
Supporting the develop of AVEVA’s security management policies, process, and procedures
Developing and implementing KPI and metric reporting related to forensic management
Serving as an escalation point on issues, dependencies, and risks related to forensic scanning and security incidents requiring deeper research
Providing technical expertise for AVEVA information security policies and standards

Managing the end-to-end vulnerability lifecycle from discovery to closure ensuring the relevant resolver team put in place a plan and timely remediation working with both managed service providers and internal IT and Information Security staff
